When a URL matches multiple categories, the category chosen is the one that has the most severe action defined below (block being most severe and allow least severe).

1 block
2 override
3 continue
4 alert
5 allow

Hello Interval (ms)
Interval in milliseconds between hello packets that are sent to verify that the HA functionality on the other firewall is operational (range is 8,000 to 60,000; default is 8,000).

The question asks if other HA firewall is "operational", the Hello only checks for availability that is related to the initial detection of the peer’s presence, simply like a ping, but heartbeats are used to monitor the status and health of the peer firewall, ensuring that it is operational and synchronized.

Hello Interval - interval in milliseconds between hello packets that are sent to verify that the HA functionality on the other firewall is operational (range is 8,000 to 60,000; default is 8,000). from the 11.0 guide: https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/high-availability/ha-concepts/ha-timers#idcc1faa1c-5cd8-4830-90da-93e8effab23d

Selected Answer: A
A. Keepalive is a ping. Heartbeat is a message sent to the other firewall to see if it's still functioning.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/high-availability/ha-concepts/failover
"Heartbeat Polling and Hello messages- The firewalls use hello message and heartbeats to verify that the peer firewall is responsive and operational. Hello messages are sent from one peer to the other at the configured Hello Interval to verify the state of the firewall. The heartbeat is an ICMP ping to the HA peer over the control link, and the peer responds to the ping to establish that the firewalls are connected and responsive. By default, the interval for the heartbeat is 1000 milliseconds. A ping is sent every 1000 milliseconds and if there are three consecutive heartbeat losses, a failovers occurs. For details on the HA timers that trigger a failover, see HA Timers."
Since the failover here talks about pings, and Heartbeat is the one that does pings, I'm leaning towards Answer C.

A. Hello Interval (ms)
Interval in milliseconds between hello packets that are sent to verify that the HA functionality on the other firewall is operational. The range is 8000-60000 ms with a default of 8000 ms for all platforms.

questions.question_text: Which three items must be configured to implement application override? (Choose three.)

An engineer is configuring a firewall with three interfaces:

• MGT connects to a switch with internet access.
• Ethernet1/1 connects to an edge router.
• Ethernet1/2 connects to a virtualization network.

The engineer needs to configure dynamic updates to use a dataplane interface for internet traffic.
What should be configured in Setup > Services > Service Route Configuration to allow this traffic?

discussion.content: This question was on the exam.. Nov 2023

Selected Answer: B
B for sure!

Selected Answer: C
U cannot use an outside interface for service routes.
It has to be an internal interface.
Then adjust routing to suit

comments.content: You can assign a service route to any dataplane interface.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B) is correct
In A) the MGT interface is not a dataplane interface as the question requests
In C) the E1/2 interface has no direct internet access as it goes to a virtualization network.

B is correct

dataplane interface. the MGMT interface is on the Controlplane.

discussion.content: The answer is "A". The question states the MGT interface is already connected to a switch with Internet access. Only need to configure DNS to point to 8.8.8.8 for resolution.
B seems to be a better option since an edge router is located at a network boundary and enables an internal network to connect to the Internet.

Selected Answer: B
Like many other PCNSE questions, this question is really weird. We don't know if the edge router has access to Internet, or if It's the virtual network which is having access to Internet. Anyway, B Looks better.

choices.C: Set DNS and Palo Alto Networks Services to use the ethernet1/2 source interface.
choices.A: Set DNS and Palo Alto Networks Services to use the MGT source interface.
choices.B: Set DNS and Palo Alto Networks Services to use the ethernet1/1 source interface.
choices.D: Set DDNS and Palo Alto Networks Services to use the MGT source interface.
